item.title: Report E-2024120003
item.description:
Report E-2024120003

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-04T12:24:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-26
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 26, 2024, four (4) 1-gallon pails of UN3149 were damaged and released approximately three (3) gallons to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the site. TWE utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2024120121
item.description:
Report X-2024120121

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-04T12:24:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-08
  • City: ROSEVILLE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Union Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024120121 Odor reported by yard crew. Responded to inspect car and found the A end liquid valve open and plug loose. Valve was cleaned and secured and plug retaped and secured tool tight. 2. X-2024120122 Odor reported by yard crew. Responded to inspect car and found the A end liquid valve open and plug loose. Valve was cleaned and secured and plug retaped and secured tool tight. 3. X-2024120123 Odor reported by yard crew. Responded to inspect car and found the A end liquid valve open and plug loose. Valve was cleaned and secured and plug retaped and secured tool tight.

item.title: Report E-2024110525
item.description:
Report E-2024110525

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-28T06:19:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-19
  • City: ADELANTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0509 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UAD. It was reported that approximately 1-quart of BERRY FLAVOR, NATURAL WONF released from a plastic drum due to unknown reasons. The release impacted concrete dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. XPO placed the spilled product and Oil-Dri inside of a steel recovery drum and will patch up the original drum and stage for terminal personnel to manage.
